question: [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/gas_schedule/table.rs] [Clone implementation] [Deep Copy Cost] When TableGasParameters is cloned (derive Clone), does this create multiple independent copies that could diverge if one is modified, or are they properly synchronized? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/gas_schedule/table.rs] [Integration: SafeNativeContext] [Context Pollution] When table natives retrieve parameters via context.charge(ADD_BOX_BASE), can a malicious native function modify the context to affect subsequent table operations in the same transaction? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/gas_schedule/table.rs] [Integration: LoaderContext] [Type Layout Caching] When get_or_create_table uses LoaderContext to generate type layouts, are these layouts cached with gas parameter versions, or can stale layouts cause incorrect per_byte charging? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/gas_schedule/table.rs] [Integration: GlobalValue] [Reference Counting] Does the gas model account for memory used by GlobalValue reference counting, or can attackers create circular table references that consume unbounded memory? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/gas_schedule/table.rs] [Integration: TableResolver] [State Divergence] If TableResolver returns different bytes for the same key on different validators, will the gas charged still be deterministic, or can this cause consensus failure? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/gas_schedule/table.rs] [Feature: FixTableNativesMemoryDoubleCounting] [Gas Inconsistency] When the FixTableNativesMemoryDoubleCounting flag is enabled mid-epoch, can validators charge different amounts for the same table operation based on when they observed the flag? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/gas_schedule/table.rs] [Feature: PAGE_SIZE rounding line 15-18] [Rounding Exploit] At gas feature version 12+, when loaded bytes are rounded up to 4KB pages, can attackers craft values just over page boundaries to maximize wasted gas charging? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/gas_schedule/table.rs] [Feature: delayed fields] [Layout Complexity] When table values contain delayed fields, does the per_byte_serialized cost account for the layout metadata overhead, or are these operations undercharged? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/gas_schedule/table.rs] [Test: keys_should_be_unique_for_all_versions] [Test Coverage] Does the uniqueness test verify that no two parameters map to the same on-chain key across ALL versions, or can version skipping cause key collisions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/gas_schedule/table.rs] [Missing validation] [Bounds Checking] Are there any runtime checks ensuring gas parameters stay within reasonable bounds (e.g., 0 < value < MAX_U64/1000), or can extreme values cause arithmetic overflow? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/gas_schedule/table.rs] [Missing validation] [Ratio Validation] Is the ratio common_load_base / common_load_per_byte validated to prevent scenarios where per-byte costs exceed base costs, inverting the cost model? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/gas_schedule/table.rs] [Missing feature: random() ] [Testing Vulnerability] The random() method (line 71-75 in macros.rs) uses rand::random for testing - could this be accidentally enabled in production builds causing non-deterministic gas? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/gas_schedule/table.rs] [Upgrade: governance proposal] [Emergency Response] If critical gas undercharging is discovered, can TableGasParameters be updated quickly via emergency governance, or would existing transactions in mempool execute at old rates? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/gas_schedule/table.rs] [Upgrade: backward compatibility] [Transaction Invalidation] When gas parameters increase via governance, can this invalidate pending transactions that calculated gas using old parameters, causing mass transaction failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/gas_schedule/table.rs] [Upgrade: version skipping] [Migration Gap] If a validator jumps from version 1 to version 10 (skipping 2-9), does the initialization correctly apply all intermediate parameter changes, or can this cause divergence? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/gas_schedule/table.rs] [Prefix: 'table' line 11] [Naming Collision] Can other gas parameter modules use the same 'table' prefix, causing on-chain key collisions when loading from GasScheduleV2? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/gas_schedule/table.rs] [BTreeMap storage] [Iteration Attack] When from_on_chain_gas_schedule iterates the BTreeMap, can a malicious governance proposal inject millions of dummy keys causing initialization to timeout? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/gas_schedule/table.rs] [Error handling: ok_or_else] [Panic in Production] If a parameter is missing from the on-chain schedule, the error message includes feature_version - can maliciously formatted version numbers cause panic during string formatting? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/gas_schedule/table.rs] [Struct field order] [ABI Stability] If new gas parameters are added to TableGasParameters, does the derive(Clone) maintain binary compatibility, or could validators with different versions interpret struct layout differently? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/gas_schedule/table.rs] [Gas algebra: GasExpression] [Complexity Attack] When table gas parameters are used in complex GasExpression trees (mul/add operations), can deeply nested expressions cause stack overflow during evaluation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/gas_schedule/table.rs] [Gas algebra: evaluate()] [Memoization Missing] Does evaluate() recompute gas on every call, or is there caching? Can attackers trigger repeated expensive evaluations by calling table operations in tight loops? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/gas_schedule/table.rs] [const handling] [Compile-time vs Runtime] Are table gas parameters truly const at runtime, or can they be modified through unsafe code, causing validators to use different values? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/gas_schedule/table.rs] [NumArgs conversion] [Type Safety] When multiplying gas parameters by NumArgs::new(1), is there validation that NumArgs is actually 1 and not a maliciously crafted value that could amplify costs? (Medium)
